TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit XmlFileEditor extends System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor

Docs.summary: Provides a user interface for selecting an XML file using a standard box.

remarks.format:
## Remarks XmlFileEditor is a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor> that provides a dialog for selecting an XML file for a file name property.
## Examples [!code-cpp[WebUITypeEditorsExample#2](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.web.ui.design.x_3_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[WebUITypeEditorsExample#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.design.x_3_1.cs)] [!code-vb[WebUITypeEditorsExample#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.design.x_3_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public override object EditValue (System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, IServiceProvider provider, object value);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance object EditValue(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, class System.IServiceProvider provider, object value) cil managed

Docs.param: An that can be used to gain additional context information.
A service provider object through which editing services may be obtained.
An instance of the value being edited.
Docs.summary: Edits the value of the specified object using the specified service provider and context.
Docs.returns: The new value of the object. If the value of the object has not changed, this method should return the same object it was passed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A service provider is provided so that any required editing services can be obtained.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance valuetype System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditorEditStyle GetEditStyle(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context) cil managed

Docs.param: An that can be used to gain additional context information.
Docs.summary: Gets the editing style associated with this editor, using the specified object.
Docs.returns: A enumeration value indicating the provided editing style. If the method is not supported in the specified context, this will return the identifier.
